content.content: Hey community! Welcome to the eleventh edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! Here we are once again with the latest news on our favorite reputation algorithm! If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements Changes in the off-chain incentive system are on! The changes involve the implementation of new initiatives as well as some specific modifications to the SourceCred main instance. Every Wednesday we activate new users! Don’t forget to sign up! We want you to join in! Payouts will be out next Friday! We will distribute 10,000 DAI based on 20,266 Cred generated last month. Delegate SourceCred payouts also going to be issued next Friday! We will be distributing 4,000 DAI based on 5,753 Cred generated. Delegates can track their activity here. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Newcomers Please welcome @Federact, @Rachel_G @Colin_F @RoFz, @Khan, and @Andres. They are our newest members of the program so If you see them out there, say hi!  Cred Stats In these last two weeks, a total of 7,214 Cred have been generated, with 76 topics and 851 posts created. As can be seen in both charts, the level of activity and Cred generation continues to decline after the peak observed at the end of June, breaking the 3,000 average cred and reaching the lowest levels of the year. The second chart shows more clearly how the level of activity falls during the second week of the period, reaching levels significantly lower than those of last year.  780×505 23.4 KB   752×518 11.3 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     2231 Governance   2130 Miscellaneous   1148 Real World Finance   939 Latin America   931 RFC    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created in the interval selected, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 4,349 that is, 60% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     618.41 “Code is Law” vs “Bankruptcy Law is Law” @christiancdpetersen   548.08 Clarifications about my take on LOVE vs MetaDAO, and a diagram of approval voting @nikolai   454.18 Decision to Delay Today’s Executive till Friday 29th @M_C   451.61 Cryptocurrencies and Credit Cards @Eumenes   418.94 Short take: return of excess funds (~2M DAI) @williamr   416.65 End-Game Summary - Part 5 @LongForWisdom   395.44 [Informal Poll] Long-Term Stablecoin Competitive Advantage @TRUEMAKER   359.39 MIP79: Recognized Delegate MKR Compensation @Patrick_J   355.78 [SIGNAL REQUEST] Budget Re-allocation & Core Unit Accountability Framework @pipko   331.17 SourceCred Bi-Weekly Happenings #10 @TheExistence    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of the last two weeks, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     226.05 MFeinberg   216.53 CodeKnight   192.60 TRUEMAKER   165.38 Saludiego-201   150.85 brigith238   144.74 Matt-NZ   118.77 Marian   111.55 Moi   82.05 alec   79.00 Andres
Welcome to the newcomers!

Thank you for the welcome. I did not think to receive this recognition in such a short time, I am very grateful to have been in the top of the best contributors and to have been awarded the badge of new user of the month. Thank you very much to all of you.

Welcome and Congratulations @Federact @Rachel_G @Colin_F @RoFz @Khan and @Andres for becoming a member of fastest growing community. We are reading you and hope to continue building and learning with you. Also Congratulations to the Top 10 contributors and the community members whose posts are selected as Top 10 contributions
Thank you!  So excited to be here.
Happy to be a part of this growing community!
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Hey community! This is the twelfth edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We are here again with the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite algorithm these last few weeks! If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements Changes in the off-chain incentive system are on! The changes involve the implementation of new initiatives as well as some specific modifications to the SourceCred main instance. Every Wednesday we activate new users! Don’t forget to sign up! We want you to join in! Please remember that to activate an account, it must have clear signs of activity such as received likes and posts made. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Cred Stats In these last two weeks, a total of 9,305 Cred have been generated, with 113 topics and 1132 posts created. As can be seen in both charts, the level of activity and Cred generation remains constant at around 4000 Cred per week, although a spike in activity at the end of last month breaks that trend. The second chart shows how this performance is consolidated during the second week, improving the performance of the same period in 2021.  Graph SC Hap #12773×512 22.8 KB   Graph2 SC Hap #12784×553 12 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     2505 Real World Finance   2268 Miscellaneous   1796 RFC   1181 Updates   1161 Governance    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created in the interval selected, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 6,303 that is, 67.7% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     2215.91 My response to unacceptable behaviour @williamr   774.29 MIP39c2-SP34: Creating RWF0x from a Split of RWF-001 @christiancdpetersen   509.01 Project-Based Budgeting @juan   503.84 Postponing Scheduled 2022-08-09 Executive @prose11   419.21 Live debate with Rune & Hasu @Hasu   416.17 Unblocking the stalled short-term bonds revenues generating initiatives @SebVentures   381.6 Urgent Executive Inclusion Request @monkey.irish   375.28 Partial collapse of civilization due to climate catastrophe is now locked in @rune   369.76 The Real Legal Risks @jacek   338.17 Circle started freezing USDC which went through Tornado Cash @Saludiego_201    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of the last two weeks, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     264.19 TRUEMAKER   221.06 MFeinberg   200.27 CodeKnight   113.37 Saludiego-201   111.82 Moi   70.00 luca-pro   67.98 Federact   57.91 spin   57.85 cryptenthusiastic   57.60 Marian
Hey, the circle freezing USDC post wasn’t written by @lyt  it was by me hehehe .
Congratulations to the top contributors  I think it was the slowest week on the forum in the last 2-3 months.

After a month break there is plenty of catching up to do, especially with the RWF story, when I looked at the RWF condition a month ago I thought wow now things are starting to roll, now I come back and am faced with a completely different situation, it never gets boring
Fixed, sorry for the mistake
yeah RWF is currently dividing certain elements of the community much more than I would have imagined.
I think there were a few of those posts but I did like yours specifically!
Congratulations Guys
@MFeinberg Your post about Arrest of developer of Tornado cash was also good, but your post got less engagement due to some similar posts on the same topic.

Thank you! That might be the case but I just wanted to community to be kept abreast of everything in this ever changing space. The actual arrest, the act of someone being taken into custody and stripped of their liberties, is obviously very important. It’s funny because that post I made, as you can see, was flagged as spam.

Congrats to all the contributors. Many really interesting posts to catch up to. @MFeinberg, the Tornado thing was quite a hot matter, to say the least. It was everywhere! only yours got flagged as spam!
Why Cred is not updating from previous one week.

There is an issue with fetching data from the forum for sourcecred, which we think was introduced by a recent update to Discourse (the forum software we use). We will update the community once a solution is available.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Hey community! This is a new edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We are here with the most recent information on what has been going on with our favorite algorithm over the past few weeks! If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. Please leave your comments below if there is anything else you would like to see added.   Announcements Payouts will be out next Friday! We will distribute 12,500 DAI based on 17,827 Cred generated last month. Delegate SourceCred payouts are also going to be issued next Friday! We will be distributing 5,000 DAI based on 6,298 Cred generated. Delegates can track their activity here. Last week we had some technical issues running the instance so this post was delayed. Everything is fixed now and working! This time we will review the last 3 weeks instead of 2 as we usually do. We will do user activations every Wednesday from now on. In this way, we believe the opt-in process will be more organized. Please remember that to activate an account, it must have clear signs of activity such as received likes and posts made. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Newcomers Please welcome @M.Bertuccio @Dilip @Freakytainment  and @WaterLily. They are our newest members of the program so If you see them out there, say hi!  Cred Stats A total of 10,018 Cred have been generated in the last three weeks, with 126 topics and 1131 posts created. We’ve had three weeks with the lowest production this year. As seen in both charts, activity and Cred generation have reached their lowest levels of the year, breaking the floor of 3,500 Cred scores per week. The second chart highlights the trend and illustrates how the three-week activity levels were consistently lower than last year.  785×507 21.6 KB   771×544 11.6 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     5284 Governance   2202 Collateral Onboarding   1473 Signal Requests   876 Delegates   768 Latin America    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created in the interval selected, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 7,642 that is, 76.2% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     1875.76 The Path of Compliance and the Path of Decentralization: Why Maker has no choice but to prepare to free float Dai @rune   991.42 Real World Assets as a Vampire Attack on Crypto @brianmcmichael   721.84 Signal Request: MKR Pro-Rata Vesting Community Sentiment Poll @teej   713.38 Endgame Plan timeline to free floating Dai @rune   676 Endgame Approval MIP Set - next steps @rune   670.78 [Signal Request] Changing USDC-PSM fees @ultraschuppi   574.25 Collateral Onboarding Project-based Funding Request(PFR) @monkey.irish   560.43 Discussion: SF and its involvement with Lido (stETH) @welsh   490.29 MakerDAO Expenses Dashboard is live! @Lenkla   367.84 Poll Inclusion Request: HVBank Legal Update @monkey.irish    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of this last two weeks, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     171.37 Marian   147.45 Khan   143.89 TRUEMAKER   116.23 Moi   115.88 iammeeoh   112.20 cryptenthusiastic   99.38 mrabino   87.79 MFeinberg   82.61 brigith238   78.42 Rahii

Welcome and Congratulations @M.Bertuccio @Dilip @Freakytainment and @WaterLily for becoming a member of fastest growing community. We are reading you and hope to continue building and learning with you. I am very grateful to have been in the top 10 contributors. Also Congratulations to all the Top contributors and the members whose posts are selected as Top 10 contributions
Yes, welcome new folks! Thanks for contributing!
Thank you very much for the welcome, I will be here to learn and contribute
Thanks @Rahii and congratulations to you too.

Thanks @TheExistence Wow I’m truly honoured to see this. Thank you Marker DAO, thanks team. I promise to devote my time and knowledge here. I’d give my best contribution to the development of the community.

Hi, @TheExistence I have a question. You announced in the first post that the Sorcecreed payouts would be issued last Friday but it hasn’t been transferred to my wallet yet. Was there a problem in general or the transfers were made and I need to contact someone in charge of Sorcecred to resolve my issue? Thanks.
Hi @Marian, we had a problem with Fryday’s distribution. Payouts were issued earlier today. You should have already received it. Please let me know if you have any problems receiving it.
I just checked my wallet and I confirm that I received the payouts. Sorry for my confusion.
I didn’t receive mine sir
Not sure what your cred was but I think payout amount has to be 50 DAI or greater to receive it.
As @TRUEMAKER mentioned above minimum withdrawal amount is 50 DAI but your DAI balance is 26.10 DAI
Oh really. It’s okay
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
